subject: Sleep
title: Synaptic Pruning During Sleep
description: One-minute skill: Synaptic Pruning During Sleep.

hook.text: Every day your brain forms thousands of new synaptic connections. Every night, it removes the ones it doesn't need.

buildup.text: During wakefulness, learning strengthens synapses. But synapses can't keep growing forever.

discovery.text: The synaptic homeostasis hypothesis says sleep globally weakens synapses, keeping only the strongest ones.

twist.text: This pruning is essential. Without it, the brain would become saturated and unable to learn the next day.

climax.text: Sleep is not just about rest. It's about refinement, sharpening signal by reducing noise.

punchline.text: Sleep prunes the weak so the strong survive.

quiz.question: What does synaptic homeostasis during sleep accomplish?
options: It globally weakens synapses, keeping only the strongest
It creates entirely new brain regions
